label: Sinai Arabic NF M 66, Undertext (Greek majuscule)

note: Very small Alexandrian majuscule with influences of Biblical majuscule (in the letters mu, pi, omega). Critical signs, diacritics, and interlinear corrections were added by a later hand (7th-8th c. CE?)

This text comes from a luxurious manuscript, whose folios measured approximately 300 x 250 mm (Turner group II). The letters are 3 mm high and 2-4 mm wide, the space between the lines is 7-8 mm. The margins are large: the internal margin measures 30 mm, the external margin 50 mm, the upper margin 40 mm (the lower margin is not preserved). The written surface is 175 x 155 mm. At the end of the lines the letters are smaller, in order to respect the line division and the justification of the margins, which is a feature typical of luxury codices

note.value: The fragmentary fols. 2r+7r+8v as well as 2v+7v+8r were originally part of one original folio
